name: Create a Business Plan
description: Writing a business plan is an important first step to getting your business up and running. An effective business plan will serve as a roadmap for the decisions you need to make, helping you obtain financing, build relationships, attract good employees, and boost your confidence as a business owner.

name: Prepare for Industry Specific Rules
description: Before you officially form and register your business, it’s important to have a target location and lease in mind, so you can create your business for your specific address. If you change the location of your business after, you will need to file an amendment to your business formation and registration.

name: Register with the State and Federal Government
description: Once you’ve confirmed your prospective location, it’s time to officially register with the State. In this step you’ll identify your desired business name, create your legal entity, and register for New Jersey State taxes.

name: Comply with Local Laws and Industry Licenses
description: After registering, you’ll sign your lease and file local permits under the protection of your new legal entity and business name.

name: Meet Inspection Requirements
description: Once your business is up and running, there are a few last municipal requirements to check on.
